#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Drive Below the Speed Limit
#Text=Driving slowly below the speed limit can be a great way to keep safe on treacherous highways , blind curves , and all sorts of other dangerous roadway hazards .
#Text=Follow these simple steps to put your safety first , before your desire to get there on time .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Maintain your speed at least below the speed limit .
#Text=This ensures you do n't go so slowly that you violate any laws applicable to where you 're driving .
#Text=The speed limits are determined by taking drivers ' speeding tendencies into account , and safe , experienced drivers know to slow down substantially in rain or snowy conditions .
#Text=Watch for speed limit changes and adjust accordingly .
#Text=Also , check the weather and the relative density of cars on the road .
#Text=Another variable you need to keep track of is the width of the road , which will give you an idea of how much space you have to maneuver .
#Text=Wider roads are o. k. for going slightly faster .
#Text=Use your own judgement .
#Text=Speed limits are an upper limit , and lower limits may exist based on the local laws , but speed is ultimately your decision .
#Text=Know what your car is capable of and watch how your car 's steering responds to the speed of the car .
#Text=The average car needs about of braking distance to come to a complete stop from ( miles per hour ) .
#Text=Keep in mind how much you want to avoid an accident .
#Text=This cannot be stressed enough
#Text=Avoid freeways if at all possible .
#Text=If you must use freeways , please stick to the right lane , and let the faster traffic pass you , even if they are driving above the speed limit .
#Text=Stay out of the fast lane .
#Text=This lane is reserved for passing and fast drivers .
#Text=You will incur less hostility if you stay in the right lane .
#Text=Avoid rush hour .
#Text=At this time , drivers are most reluctant to be caught behind you
#Text=Get a substantially less powerful car .
#Text=This way , you will not be tempted to pass the speed limit .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Get in touch with other drivers who respect the speed limit .
#Text=Form a club or association to establish more clout in persuading local authorities to enforce the speed limit .
#Text=Find a new job closer to home .
#Text=This way , you can make up for the lost time in your commute .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=You may hear a lot more horns , and be flipped off a lot more often by other drivers .
#Text=Do n't drive with an uncalibrated speedometer .
#Text=It is important to know exactly how fast you are going .
#Text=Try to drive on streets with many red lights .
#Text=This will make your slower driving more palatable to fellow drivers .
#Text=Do n't drive this way in the United States or any major city abroad .
#Text=Avoid freeways , or at least do n't get in the way of people who wish to drive faster .
